decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The operations comprising the rear dormer roof extension would consist of the enlargement of a dwelling house within the meaning of Class B of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Town & Country Planning (General Permitted Development)  (England) Order 2015 "the Order" and would comply with the development tolerances set out in said Class B. The operation would therefore have been granted planning permission by Article 3 of the Order.

Condition : 2 - The operations comprising the installation of x3 roof lights to the front roof slope, would consist of any other alteration to the roof of the dwelling house within the meaning of Class C of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Town & Country Planning (General Permitted Development)  (England) Order 2015 "the Order" and would comply with the development tolerances set out in said Class C. The operation would therefore have been granted planning permission by Article 3 of the Order.

Reason : 1 - Insufficient information has been submitted to prove satisfactorily that the hip to gable and rear dormer have been in place for a continuous period of four or more years and consequently it has not been demonstrated that the works are lawful within the meaning of Section 191 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).
description: APPLICATION FOR A LAWFUL DEVELOPMENT CERTIFICATE IN RESEPCT OF THE RETENTION OF EXISTING REAR DORMER ROOF EXTENSION WITH 3 x ROOFLIGHTS TO FRONT ROOF SLOPE.
